instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi.
I have a macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power no green light. i get on <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> just pic 6 VIN and then it drops no out. Any suggestion?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> just pic 6 VIN"
What about pin8???

Just in case, check diode mode at L7095.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: There was some liquid damage before and i replaced a bunch of components and just realized that i soldered <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> instead of on it's own place it was from <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> pin 2 to <RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> pin 1 :ROFLMAO: my mistake :D Thank you very much for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: You're welcome, glad to hear is solved...
